meta.title: Combine: AI Blog Post Generator
meta.description: Orchestrating OpenAI + WordPress APIs into a combined endpoint

steps.content:
The /combine command supports two modes:

  [A] API Combine - Orchestrate multiple APIs into one endpoint
  [B] UI Combine  - Compose components into pages (Coming Soon)
⚠️  Combine workflow requires 2+ existing APIs in registry

Based on the name "create-ai-blog-post", this appears to combine:

  1. AI Content Generation (OpenAI/Claude)
  2. Blog Publishing (WordPress/CMS)

Let me check your existing APIs...

Found compatible APIs in registry:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  AVAILABLE SOURCE APIs                                      │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  ✓ /api/v2/chat          - OpenAI chat completions          │
│  ✓ /api/v2/generate-text - Claude text generation           │
│  ✓ /api/v2/wordpress     - WordPress REST API wrapper       │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Which APIs should this combined endpoint orchestrate?
[a] /api/v2/chat + /api/v2/wordpress
[b] /api/v2/generate-text + /api/v2/wordpress
[c] Custom selection
Researching orchestration patterns for AI → CMS workflows...
WebSearch: "AI content generation WordPress API integration patterns"
WebSearch: "API orchestration sequential vs parallel patterns"

Research complete. Orchestration patterns:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  ORCHESTRATION PATTERNS                                     │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  Sequential:   API1 → transform → API2 → response           │
│  Parallel:     API1 ─┬─ merge ─→ response                   │
│                API2 ─┘                                      │
│  Conditional:  API1 → if(condition) → API2 else API3        │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  RECOMMENDED FOR AI→WordPress:                              │
│  Sequential with data transformation                        │
│  1. Generate content with AI                                │
│  2. Transform to WordPress post format                      │
│  3. Create/update WordPress post                            │
│  4. Return combined result                                  │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
Based on my research, I have questions about your orchestration needs.

Q1/5: What should the flow be?
       [a] Generate → Auto-publish (no review)
       [b] Generate → Return draft → User publishes separately
       [c] Generate → Review step → Publish if approved
Flow: Generate → Review → Publish if approved

Q2/5: If AI generation fails, what should happen?
       [a] Return error immediately
       [b] Retry up to 3 times
       [c] Return partial result with error details
AI failure: Retry up to 3 times

Q3/5: If WordPress publish fails, should we save the generated content?
       [a] Yes, save as draft in WordPress
       [b] Yes, return content in response for manual save
       [c] No, discard everything
Publish failure: Save as WordPress draft

Q4/5: WordPress post status options:
       [a] Always publish immediately
       [b] Always save as draft first
       [c] Let caller choose (publish | draft | pending)
Post status: Caller chooses (publish | draft | pending)

Q5/5: Should we add SEO metadata generation?
       [a] Yes, generate title, excerpt, and meta tags
       [b] No, just the main content
SEO: Yes, generate title + excerpt + meta tags

Based on your interview answers, I need additional research.

PROPOSED SEARCHES:
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  1. "WordPress REST API retry patterns authentication"      │
│     Reason: You chose retry on failure                      │
│                                                             │
│  2. "OpenAI API SEO metadata generation best practices"     │
│     Reason: You want SEO generation included                │
│                                                             │
│  3. "API orchestration draft fallback patterns"             │
│     Reason: You want draft save on publish failure          │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
WebSearch: "WordPress REST API retry patterns authentication"
WebSearch: "OpenAI API SEO metadata generation best practices"
Creating combined schema from source APIs...
Source schemas loaded - creating combined wrapper
Environment ready. Proceed to write integration tests?

Planning integration tests for combined flow...

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  TEST MATRIX FOR COMBINED ENDPOINT                          │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  1. Happy path: Generate → SEO → Publish                    │
│  2. AI failure: Retry 3x then error                         │
│  3. WordPress failure: Save as draft fallback               │
│  4. SEO generation: Title + excerpt + meta                  │
│  5. Status options: publish | draft | pending               │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  MOCKING: Source APIs will be mocked                        │
│  • Mock /api/v2/chat responses                              │
│  • Mock /api/v2/wordpress responses                         │
